dialog.text: What are the main types of journaling, and what do they do for me?
Great question. Each type is a doorway to a different part of your life, and you choose the door that fits you today.
Can you name a few so I can pick one?

Reflective journaling to unpack events; Gratitude journaling to notice the good; Bullet journaling to organize your day; Dream journaling to map your night thoughts; Art journaling to color your inner world; Travel journaling to capture places and feelings.
That sounds doable. I want something simple but meaningful.
Start with one you can keep upâ€”five minutes a day is enough to begin; you can mix in others later.
So the best type is the one you actually do.
Exactly. Consistency beats complexity; a small habit grows a bigger vision.
I'm in. Which one should I try first?
Pick a door: Reflective, Gratitude, or Bullet. Try it this week and share in the comments which you chose and why.
